main event: A civilian reported a small red object moving rapidly, hovering, and then disappearing in Dayton, Ohio, on 7th July 1956. The observation lasted for 12 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting was dismissed as a balloon sighting by the weather service.
The document includes a U.S. Air Force technical information sheet to gather detailed information about the unidentified aerial phenomenon.
The witness was asked about the size, shape, color, and behavior of the observed object.
There were questions about the sighting conditions, such as the time of day, sky condition, and the position of the sun.
The observer was also asked to estimate the speed and distance of the object.
